name: chatgpt_env_marine_gdmi_rf
description: [ChatGPT Env] GDMI RF offshore â†’ BLOCK, suggest GDMI-ZM (C5)

turns.content: **Important:** RF (stainless steel) is **not available** for GDMI. Available material options: Aluzink, Zinkmagnesium. Please select an available material to proceed.This configuration for your offshore project is blocked. GDMI housings are not suitable for marine environments due to the presence of Salt Spray, High Humidity, and Outdoor Condensation. The bolted construction of the GDMI housing does not meet the leakage class and hygiene requirements for marine environments, which require C5.1 marine-grade corrosion resistance (acid-proof stainless).No standard catalog product satisfies all requirements simultaneously. To meet your needs, a solution would require C5.1 marine-grade corrosion resistance and a construction that meets the leakage class and hygiene requirements for marine environments. I recommend contacting our Custom Engineering or Technical Support team with these specific technical requirements.

gemini.explanation: The system correctly identified a specific catalog constraint that overrides general product family information: while the general summary lists stainless steel (RF) as a material, the specific GDMI page explicitly states it is not available in stainless steel. The system also correctly applied environmental engineering logic to block an indoor-rated housing for offshore use due to corrosion risks.

dimension_explanations.correctness: Correctly identifies that GDMI is 'Ej i Rostfritt' (Not in Stainless) per PDF p.11, despite the general summary on p.3 listing RF.
dimension_explanations.completeness: Fully addresses the material unavailability, explains the environmental incompatibility, and suggests a custom engineering path.
dimension_explanations.safety: Correctly blocks a non-marine grade housing for an offshore application, preventing rapid corrosion failure.
dimension_explanations.reasoning_quality: Excellent deduction linking the 'Indoor use' (p.11) and material limitations to the harsh requirements of an offshore environment.
dimension_explanations.constraint_adherence: Strictly adheres to the specific product limitation 'Ej i Rostfritt' found in the text of page 11.

strengths: Accurate detection of specific product constraints (No RF for GDMI) vs general family traits
Sound engineering logic regarding marine/offshore corrosion risks (C5 requirements)
pdf_citations: GDMI Material: 'Ej i Rostfritt' (Not in Stainless) (PDF p.11)
GDMI Application: 'FÃ¶r inomhusbruk' (For indoor use) (PDF p.11)
GDMI Standard Material: 'tillverkas vanligen i ZM' (PDF p.11)

openai.explanation: The system correctly flags that GDMI is not offered in RF stainless per the catalog, but it then overreaches by declaring GDMI unsuitable for marine/offshore due to leakage/hygiene and demanding C5.1 acid-proof stainlessâ€”constraints not supported by the provided PDF for these housings. It also blocks without proposing a valid in-catalog offshore-appropriate alternative (e.g., selecting ZM or SF/RF options in other families where applicable).

dimension_explanations.correctness: Correct that GDMI is offered in AZ/ZM (not RF) and that GDMI 600x600 has 3400 mÂ³/h per table, but the claims about bolted construction not meeting leakage/hygiene for marine and requiring C5.1 acid-proof are not substantiated by the PDF and are too categorical for this catalog context.
dimension_explanations.completeness: It addresses material availability and gives a block rationale, but it does not explore alternative catalog families/materials (e.g., ZM for GDMI or RF/SF/ZM options in other housings) or ask key install details (indoor/outdoor, location, chemical exposure).
dimension_explanations.safety: Reasonably highlights offshore salt spray/high humidity corrosion risk and avoids approving an invalid configuration, but the hard block could mislead by implying no safe standard option exists without checking other families/materials.
dimension_explanations.tone: Professional and direct, with clear notification of the block and next step to contact technical support.
dimension_explanations.reasoning_quality: Some cause-effect logic on marine corrosion is sound, but it contains logical jumps (leakage class/hygiene requirements asserted for offshore without evidence; equating offshore with mandatory C5.1 acid-proof).
dimension_explanations.constraint_adherence: It correctly enforces the catalog constraint 'GDMI not available in RF', but it incorrectly adds extra constraints (GDMI categorically not suitable for marine; must be C5.1 acid-proof) and therefore blocks beyond documented product rules.

strengths: Correctly identifies that GDMI is not available in RF stainless and requests an available material (AZ/ZM).
Appropriately considers corrosion drivers in offshore environments (salt spray, humidity/condensation).
weaknesses: Introduces unsupported constraints (leakage/hygiene/bolted construction disqualification; mandatory C5.1 acid-proof stainless) not evidenced in the provided catalog excerpt.
Fails to propose a viable catalog-based alternative or to clarify whether the unit is actually outdoors/offshore exposed vs installed in protected indoor technical spaces.
pdf_citations: GDMI 'tillverkas vanligen i ZM. Ej i rostfritt' and example order line shows GDMI-600x600-600-R-PG-AZ (catalog GDMI section).

anthropic.explanation: The system correctly identifies that GDMI is not available in RF (stainless steel) per the PDF catalog (only AZ and ZM are listed), and appropriately blocks the configuration for offshore/marine use. The engineering reasoning about marine environments requiring C5.1 corrosion resistance is sound, though the specific claim about 'bolted construction' leakage/hygiene requirements is somewhat imprecise â€” the real issue is material suitability and the fact that GDMI is rated for indoor use only. The recommendation to contact custom engineering is appropriate.

dimension_explanations.correctness: PDF p.11 confirms GDMI is available only in AZ and ZM (not RF/SF), and states 'Ej i Rostfritt' â€” the system correctly blocks RF. The claim about 'bolted construction' hygiene requirements is slightly imprecise; the primary issue is that GDMI is for indoor use only and lacks C5.1-rated materials.
dimension_explanations.completeness: The response covers material unavailability, environment unsuitability, and provides a path forward (custom engineering), but could have explicitly mentioned that GDC or GDB in SF (acid-proof stainless, C5.1) might be explored as alternatives for offshore.
dimension_explanations.safety: Correctly blocks an unsafe configuration â€” offshore/marine environments demand C5.1 corrosion resistance, and GDMI's available materials (AZ=C4, ZM=C5) plus its indoor-only rating make it unsuitable.
dimension_explanations.tone: Professional and consultative, clearly explains the block and provides a constructive next step, though the warning formatting is slightly abrupt.
dimension_explanations.reasoning_quality: Clear cause-effect chain linking offshore environment to salt spray/humidity requirements to material and construction inadequacy, though the 'bolted construction' leakage claim could be more precisely stated as 'indoor-only rated housing.'
dimension_explanations.constraint_adherence: Fully respects the material constraint (no RF for GDMI) and the environment constraint (GDMI is for indoor use only), correctly blocking the configuration.

strengths: Correctly identifies that RF is not available for GDMI, matching the PDF specification 'Ej i Rostfritt'
Appropriately blocks the offshore configuration and recommends custom engineering as a path forward
weaknesses: Does not suggest alternative product families (e.g., GDC or GDB in SF material) that might partially address the offshore requirement

The reasoning about 'bolted construction' leakage/hygiene requirements is somewhat imprecise â€” the core issue is that GDMI is explicitly indoor-only and the available materials don't include C5.1-rated options
pdf_citations: GDMI page 11: 'GDMI tillverkas vanligen i ZM. Ej i Rostfritt.' â€” confirms RF is not available
GDMI page 11: Material options shown as AZ and ZM only, corrosion class C4
GDMI page 11: 'FÃ¶r inomhusbruk' â€” confirms indoor use only

No standard catalog product satisfies all requirements simultaneously. To meet your needs, a solution would require C5.1 marine-grade corrosion resistance and a construction that meets the leakage class and hygiene requirements for marine environments.
